INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the atanazavir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together proves necessary, adjustment of the dosage of the atazanavir with regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Doubling of the concentrations of nevirapine with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the nevirapine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the amprenavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the indinavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical and biological monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of nevirapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole, for one thing, and decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine, for another thing.
Risk of significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of the nevirapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the nevirapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole during the administration of the substances together.
